conclusion: Understanding the setup of the problem with various tracks and points.
Description of the horizontal platform, rough straight track AB, horizontal smooth track BC, quarter-circular pipe CD, and semi-circular track DEF.
Points O1, D, O2, and F are on the same horizontal line.
Slider starts from rest at point P on track AB, slides down, and collides with a ball on track BC.
After collision, the ball moves through pipe CD, track DEF, and vertically downwards from point F.
Ball collides with triangular prism G, velocity direction becomes horizontal, and lands at point Q.
Minimum value of h for the ball to complete motion is 0.45 m, and ball barely passes point E.
Need to find maximum horizontal distance x_max between landing point Q and point F.
Analyzing motion of slider and ball up to collision point on track BC.
Slider starts from rest at point P, slides down inclined track AB with friction.
Net force on slider down incline is mg sin θ - μ mg cos θ.
Acceleration down incline is a = g (sin θ - μ cos θ).
Distance s slider travels down incline is s = h / sin θ.
